text: The 2019 North Carolina Central Eagles football team represented North Carolina Central University in the 2019 NCAA Division I FCS football season. They were led by first-year head coach Trei Oliver. The Eagles played their home games at O'Kelly–Riddick Stadium. They were a member of the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC). They finished the season 4–8, 3–5 in MEAC play to finish in sixth place. ==Previous season== The Eagles finished the 2018 season 5–6, 3–4 in MEAC play to finish in a tie for sixth place. ==Preseason== ===MEAC poll=== In the MEAC preseason poll released on July 26, 2019, the Eagles were predicted to finish in fifth place. {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || North Carolina A&T; || 304 (12) |- align="center" | 2 || Bethune–Cookman || 237 (1) |- align="center" | 3 || Florida A&M; || 204 (2) |- align="center" | 4 || Howard || 166 |- align="center" | 5 || North Carolina Central || 161 (1) |- align="center" | 6 || South Carolina State || 152 |- align="center" | 7 || Norfolk State || 119 (1) |- align="center" | 8 || Morgan State || 87 (1) |- align="center" | 9 || Delaware State || 46 |} ===Preseason All–MEAC teams=== The Eagles had seven players selected to the preseason all-MEAC teams.
